item.title: SIPS Workshop: Redesigning methods curricula for reproducibility
Everything is cool when you’re part of a team: The role of large-scale collaboration in improving replicability and generalisability
Improving the generalisability and replicability of psychological science
Open Science Toolbox: Leveraging Methodological Reforms to Accelerate Research
item.description: Crowdsourcing Psychological Science Benedict Jones Crowdsourcing presents a solution to problems of low power and lack of diversity in research samples that often undermine conclusions from psychological research. I will focus on my lab’s experience conducting a preregistered study through the Psychological Science Accelerator, a globally distributed network of >350 laboratories from >45 countries. Do Psychological Effects Vary across Sample and Setting? Findings from Many Labs 2 Richard Klein This talk presents results from Many Labs 2, a recent large-scale project in which 28 psychological effects were replicated across 125 samples from 36 countries (N = 15,305).

item.title: Replication and Generalisation: Crowdsourcing Better Research
